## cause rates

```{r imports}
library(here)
library(tidyverse)
library(cowplot)
library(colorspace)
library(geojsonsf)
library(sf)
library(ggridges)
library(GGally)

source(here("thesis_analysis", "theme_thesis.R"))
```

## data

```{r data}
args <- lst(
  region = "LAD",
  sex = "female",
  model = "car_as_at",
)

cause_q <- read_rds(
  here(
    "data",
    "death_rates",
    str_c(
      args$region,
      "_",
      args$sex,
      "_",
      args$model,
      "_",
      "cancers_80q0",
      ".rds"
    )
  )
)

shape <- geojson_sf(here("data", "covariates", "LAD2020_ENG_BGC.geojson"))

if (args$sex == "male") {
  cause_list <- c(
    "Trachea bronchus lung cancers",
    "Prostate cancer",
    "Colon and rectum cancers",
    "Oesophagus cancer",
    "Lymphomas multiple myeloma",
    "Pancreas cancer",
    "Bladder cancer",
    "Leukaemia",
    "Liver cancer",
    "Kidney and ureter cancer",
    "All other cancers"
  )
} else {
  cause_list <- c(
    "Trachea bronchus lung cancers",
    "Breast cancer",
    "Colon and rectum cancers",
    "Pancreas cancer",
    "Ovary cancer",
    "Lymphomas multiple myeloma",
    "Oesophagus cancer",
    "Leukaemia",
    "Corpus uteri cancer",
    "Liver cancer",
    "All other cancers"
  )
}

imd <- read_csv(here("data", "covariates", "IMD_LAD2020_2019.csv")) |>
  mutate(`income rank` = rank(`income score`))

lookup <- read_csv(
  here(
    "data",
    "covariates",
    "LSOA_MSOA_LAD_GOR_CTRY_lookup.csv"
  )
) |>
  select(LAD2020, LAD2020NM, GOR2011, GOR2011NM) |>
  distinct() |>
  arrange(LAD2020)

n_lad <- length(unique(lookup$LAD2020NM))

regions <- c(
  "North East",
  "North West",
  "Yorkshire and The Humber",
  "East Midlands",
  "West Midlands",
  "East of England",
  "South East",
  "South West",
  "London"
)

region_col <- c(
  "#1F78B4",
  "#E31A1C",
  "#FF7F00",
  "#B15928",
  "#A6CEE3",
  "#33A02C",
  "#6A3D9A",
  "#FDBF6F",
  "#FB9A99"
)
```

```{r calculate median 80q0 in over time}
median_q <- apply(
  X = cause_q,
  MARGIN = c(1, 2, 4),
  FUN = median
) |>
  as.data.frame.table(stringsAsFactors = FALSE) |>
  as_tibble() |>
  rename(`80q0` = Freq) |>
  mutate(year = as.integer(year)) |>
  arrange()
```

```{r calculate median 80q0 change 2002-2019}
median_q_change <- apply(
  X = cause_q["2019", , , ] - cause_q["2002", , , ],
  MARGIN = c(1, 3),
  FUN = median
) |>
  as.data.frame.table(stringsAsFactors = FALSE) |>
  as_tibble() |>
  rename(d80q0 = Freq)
```

## maps

Maps of 80q0 in 2019.
```{r map 80q0 in 2019}
for (disease in cause_list) {
  print(disease)
  map <- shape |>
    left_join(
      median_q |> filter(cause == disease) |> mutate(LAD2020 = LAD)
    ) |>
    ggplot(aes(fill = `80q0`)) +
    geom_sf(colour = "white", size = 0.1) +
    scale_fill_continuous_sequential(
      palette = "Reds",
      name = ""
    ) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(legend.position = "none")
  guides(
    fill = guide_colorbar(
      title.position = "top",
      title.hjust = 0
    )
  )

  p <- median_q |>
    filter(cause == disease) |>
    ggplot(aes(x = `80q0`, y = 1, fill = after_stat(x))) +
    geom_density_ridges_gradient(colour = "#cccccc", size = 0.1) +
    scale_fill_continuous_sequential(
      palette = "Reds",
      name = str_c("Probability of death for \n", disease)
    ) +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0)) +
    theme_void() +
    theme(
      legend.direction = "horizontal",
      legend.position = "bottom",
      legend.key.width = unit(15, units = "pt"),
      legend.key.height = unit(5, units = "pt"),
      legend.text = element_text(size = 4),
      legend.title = element_text(
        size = 4,
        face = "bold"
      )
    ) +
    guides(
      fill = guide_colorbar(
        title.position = "bottom",
        title.hjust = 0
      )
    )

  grid <- ggdraw(map) +
    draw_plot(p, -0.15, 0.05, scale = 0.2)

  save_plot(
    here(
      "thesis_analysis",
      "cancers",
      "figures",
      str_c("map_", str_replace(disease, " ", "_"), "_", args$sex, ".pdf")
    ),
    grid
  )
}
```

## pair plots

Pair plot of 80q0 in 2019
```{r 80q0 correlation plot in 2019}
p <- median_q |>
  filter(year == 2019) |>
  pivot_wider(
    id_cols = c(LAD),
    names_from = cause,
    values_from = `80q0`
  ) |>
  select(all_of(cause_list)) |>
  ggcorr(size = 0)

p <- p + geom_text(
  data = tibble(x = seq(cause_list), y = seq(cause_list), lbs = cause_list),
  aes(x, y, label = str_wrap(lbs, 15)),
  nudge_x = -0.5,
  hjust = 0,
  size = 1.5
) +
  theme_thesis() +
  theme(axis.line = element_blank())

save_plot(
  here(
    "thesis_analysis",
    "cancers",
    "figures",
    str_c("correlation_", args$sex, ".pdf")
  ),
  p
)
```

## time series

```{r plot time series}
for (disease in cause_list) {
  print(disease)
  p <- median_q |>
    filter(cause == disease) |>
    mutate(LAD2020 = LAD) |>
    left_join(lookup) |>
    ggplot(
      aes(
        x = year,
        y = `80q0`,
        group = LAD
      )
    ) +
    geom_line(size = 0.1) +
    facet_wrap(
      ~ factor(GOR2011NM, levels = regions),
      labeller = label_wrap_gen(20)
    ) +
    scale_x_continuous(breaks = scales::breaks_width(2)) +
    labs(
      x = "",
      y = "Probability of death",
      caption = disease
    ) +
    theme_thesis() +
    theme(
      panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),
      panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank()
    )

  save_plot(
    here(
      "thesis_analysis",
      "cancers",
      "figures",
      str_c("series_", str_replace(disease, " ", "_"), "_", args$sex, ".pdf")
    ),
    p
  )
}
```

## poverty

```{r plot IMD}
p <- median_q |>
  filter(year == 2019) |>
  mutate(LAD2020 = LAD) |>
  left_join(imd |> select(LAD2020, `income rank`)) |>
  left_join(lookup) |>
  ggplot(
    aes(
      x = `income rank`,
      y = `80q0`,
      colour = factor(GOR2011NM, levels = regions)
    )
  ) +
  geom_point(size = 0.1) +
  facet_wrap(
    ~ factor(cause, levels = cause_list),
    scales = "free",
    labeller = label_wrap_gen(20)
  ) +
  labs(
    x = "Income deprivation rank",
    y = "Probability of death in 2019"
  ) +
  scale_colour_manual(values = region_col, name = "") +
  scale_x_continuous(
    breaks = c(n_lad / 7, 6 * n_lad / 7),
    labels = c("Least deprived", "Most deprived")
  ) +
  theme_thesis() +
  theme(
    legend.key.size = unit(0.01, "npc"),
    panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),
    axis.ticks.x = element_blank()
  )

save_plot(
  here(
    "thesis_analysis",
    "cancers",
    "figures",
    str_c("IMD_", args$sex, ".pdf")
  ),
  p
)
```

## distribution

```{r calculate quantiles 80q0 in 2002 and 2019}
quantile_q <- apply(
  X = cause_q[c("2002", "2019"), , , ],
  MARGIN = c(1, 2, 4),
  FUN = quantile,
  p = c(0.025, 0.5, 0.975)
) |>
  as.data.frame.table(stringsAsFactors = FALSE) |>
  as_tibble() |>
  rename(quantile = Var1, `80q0` = Freq) |>
  arrange() |>
  pivot_wider(names_from = quantile, values_from = `80q0`) |>
  group_by(year, cause) |>
  mutate(rank = rank(`50%`))
```

```{r distribution plot}
p <- quantile_q |>
  ggplot(aes(x = rank, colour = year)) +
  geom_segment(aes(xend = rank, y = `2.5%`, yend = `97.5%`), alpha = 0.1) +
  geom_point(aes(y = `50%`), size = 0.1) +
  facet_wrap(
    ~ factor(cause,
      levels = cause_list
    ),
    scales = "free",
    labeller = label_wrap_gen(20)
  ) +
  labs(
    x = "Ranking of median 80q0 across districts",
    y = "Probability of death"
  ) +
  scale_colour_manual(
    values = c("Grey50", "Grey10"),
    name = ""
  ) +
  theme_thesis() +
  theme(
    legend.position = "top",
    axis.text.x = element_blank(),
    axis.ticks.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),
  )

save_plot(
  here(
    "thesis_analysis",
    "cancers",
    "figures",
    str_c("distribution_", args$sex, ".pdf")
  ),
  p
)
```
